title: Eugene 2021 organisers invite drugs-cheat protege of Alberto Salazar to official launch
text:
Organisers of the next athletics World Championships invited a drugs-cheat protege of Sir Mo Farah’s disgraced former coach to the event’s official launch.

Hours before it was announced the Nike Oregon Project would shut down in the wake of Alberto Salazar’s ban for doping offences, Eugene 2021 paraded Mary Decker Slaney at its “official kick-off event” on Thursday.

Decker Slaney, suspended for two years and stripped of her 1997 World Indoor Championships silver medal after testing positive for testosterone, was among 11 US world champions past and present who attended the curtain-raiser at the University of Oregon.

The 61-year-old was invited as a result of her triumphs in the 1,500 metres and 3,000m at the inaugural World Championships in 1983.

She was joined by long-jump world record holder and two-time world champion Mike Powell, as well as sprint legend and BBC pundit Michael Johnson.
